title: Advice for recovery and life after bypass
text:
Hey everyone. 

My mothers just had her gastric bypass. Ive been caring for her for most of my life - Im 25m. There was a lot of anxiety leading up to the surgery but the main point of the quality of her life and health improving helped to alleviate a lot of those worries. Thank God, it went smoothly and shes currently recovering in the ward. I joined this community just to get more understanding on the day to day. I think this is an amazing and affirming space. 

I was wondering if anyone had some advice for those caring for people who have had the surgery? What was the 2 week diet progression like? What would you recommend I do? Are there any absolute dos/donts? From my many interrogations with doctors, I know about the vitamins, dumping etc - but I wanted some insights from those who have been through it. 

Any tips would be greatly appreciated! 

My mother and I are based in London, England.
relevance_reason: Strong bariatric context with focus on caregiving and recovery but no direct PBH or treatment discussion.
